content.description:
Climb the semi-overhanging arete across from

Billiam

. A TR anchor requires lots of webbing as anchor options are far back from the edge.
content.protection: N/A. This is a TR only.
content.location: It is in the south end of The Grotto.

content.description:
Start 30 feet right of

Bumbles Bounce

. Scrappy climbing leads to a ledge and then to a beautiful crack in a left-facing dihedral. The crack isn't obvious from the ground. Too bad the crack doesn't go all the way to the ground or this would be a Castlewood classic.
content.protection: Finger pieces/nuts and hand-sized pieces for the anchor.
content.location: It is the furthest right route at The Grotto.

content.description: Climb the face eastern face in The Grotto just under the "land bridge." Avoid using the back chimney.
content.protection: N/A. It is a TR only.
content.location: It is the Easternmost, bolted, TR line at The Grotto.

content.description: I found this more enjoyable than the TR face that has the bolts, since it's hard not to use the chimney on that route. Climb the chimney just under the "land bridge."
content.protection: A medium cam for mid-section. It is a PG-13 lead.

content.description: Begin with easy but grubby climbing to a ledge at the base of the giant roof crack. Then climb up the crack, traverse right (super fun) under the roof, and continue through the OWish finish. Other than being dirty and lichen-covered, the climbing is enjoyable. The crux is 2/3rds of the way through the roof.
content.protection: A single BD rack to a #6. Double #6s would be advised (a #5 is a bit tipped out).
content.location: This ascends the roof crack on the left side of The Grotto.

content.description: Climb up the face out of the chimney on the western edge of The Grotto. Tricky sequencing and decent crimps and pockets lead to the top.
content.protection: TR using bolts at the top.
content.location: It is the Westernmost bolted TR route at The Grotto. The bolts are located behind 3 large boulders.

content.description: This climb is on the inside of The Grotto and goes up the thin dihedral on the inner N facing wall.  Begin the route by climbing up to the dihedral on the face as well as the small roof.  The climb follows the dihedral, offering thin jams and pro opportunities.
content.protection: A few small small pieces protect the climb while some additional gear/slings is needed for the top anchor.

pathTokens: Denver Metropolitan Area Bouldering and Buildering
